meanings.definition: To turn into or present as a myth.
meanings.sent1: The storyteller mythicizes the ordinary events to make them seem magical.
meanings.sent2: The author mythicizes historical figures to create captivating tales.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as their friend mythicizes a simple game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork mythicizes nature, transforming it into a mystical realm.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush mythicizes reality, painting a world of enchantment.

meanings.definition: To make something seem mythical or legendary.
meanings.sent1: The movie director mythicizes the hero's journey, adding fantastical elements.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins mythicizes the civilization that once thrived there.
meanings.sent3: The chef mythicizes the humble potato, turning it into a legendary dish.
meanings.sent4: The poet mythicizes love, portraying it as an eternal force.
meanings.sent5: The folklore mythicizes the origins of the mystical creatures.
